Pippa, her cuddly friend Boo and blankey Snuggly like to play and have fun. You can find them in books and games and they’re also available as plush toys.  They are designed to boost early language development.  

This app can be used in several ways. By default,  ”intructions” and ”naming” are turned on in settings and the  app will name the items the child points to, and the child will get to help Pippa and Boo by following simple instructions. In this way we help build vocabulary and language comprehension. 
  
With ”instructions” and ”naming” turned off it’s possible to just play freely in the app instead. If a grown-up is present and talks about what’s happening in the game, and gives instructions at the right level for the child, the child’s language can grow even more!

We have all at one time or another had challenges in our daily communication. With this tool you become a skillful communicator. Here you train yourself in recognizing other people's behaviour patterns, which will be of great benefit in all future meetings. For example, how do you meet an introvert if you are an extrovert yourself? In what way can you separate factual issues from personal ones? How do you adapt more quickly to people around you and get what you want? You find the answers here. With the help of Surrounded by idiots, all interaction with others becomes both smoother and easier.

The app contains many areas of knowledge about different behaviours. You regularly test your skills through different types of quizzes and through concrete problem solving of different relationship challenges. In just a few minutes you can also do a simplified behavioural analysis of both yourself and others. Then you receive a recommendation on which strategy you should use towards different individuals. It cannot be more simple!

The content is easily accessible and entertaining, at the same time as you build real skills around how to handle everyone you meet from now on.

Surrounded by idiots is for both you who are interested in yourself and your own personal development, and for you who are curious about how other people work - and why. Have you ever had trouble understanding people around you? Are you tired of poor communication and misunderstandings? Are you looking for tools to easier get along with others? Then this is the app for you.

The biggest benefit is that from day one you will increase your social skills. You will understand people around you in a completely different way. Your various interactions with people you meet will be seen in a whole new light. The amount of unnecessary conflicts will decrease, and you will more easily understand both your partner and – why not your boss. And, not least, they will understand you.

The app costs no more than a lunch but contains insights you will benefit from for years.
It is based on the best-selling book Surrounded by Idiots. And builds on the worldwide model with the four colours: red, yellow, green and blue. The fundamentals can be traced all the way back to Carl Jung.

Push, see and listen! Babyloonz Animal Friends is a very intuitive and easy to use app that teaches your little one about animals. The app has two different game modes that entertains and educates small children in a way they can understand and love!

Start the app and start playing - easy and safe! At the bottom of the screen you find a menu that allows you to change the game mode. To the left you find the three animal pages. Play with letters, sounds and words together with Alfie Atkins. Children love learning new things through play. This app, Play ABC, Alfie Atkins, stimulates children's language learning skills by clearly connecting the function and purpose of letters in an experimental, playful way.

Alfie has some extraordinary devices in his room: a letter tracer, a word machine and a puppet theatre. With the letter tracer, children will learn the appearance and sound of all letters and train their motor skills and muscle memory by drawing and tracing letters on the screen. Using Alfie's homemade word machine, children will spell new words using phonemes and letter tips. All new words are sent to the puppet theatre, where children use their creativity and imagination to tell fantastic stories. This playloop, with concrete results, has a motivational effect and helps children develop their language skills at their own pace.

Play ABC, Alfie Atkins is developed by language teachers and game designers. It was created and tested in collaboration with teachers and students of schools in Finland and Sweden. The app has been developed based on children's needs and does not feature points, time limits or other elements that could lead to failure or stress. Children will play and learn using the app on their own terms and at their own pace, in preschool, at school or at home.

Play and learn:
  • The sounds, phonemes and names of letters
  • How to trace letters

  • How to read simple words
  • Upper and lowercase letters
